border bg-card text-card-foreground shadow-sm mb-8","children":["$","div",null,{"className":"p-8","children":["$","div",null,{"className":"prose prose-lg max-w-none prose-headings:text-gray-900 prose-p:text-gray-700 prose-a:text-blue-600 prose-strong:text-gray-900 prose-ul:text-gray-700 prose-ol:text-gray-700 prose-li:text-gray-700 prose-code:text-pink-600 prose-pre:bg-gray-100","children":[["$","h1","h1-0",{"children":"Module Testing with Code Examples"}],"\n",["$","p","p-0",{"children":"Do you think the module works well? Let's explore some practical examples!"}],"\n",["$","h2","h2-0",{"children":"JavaScript Testing"}],"\n",["$","p","p-1",{"children":"Here's a simple JavaScript module test:"}],"\n",["$","pre","pre-0",{"children":["$","code","code-0",{"className":"language-javascript","children":"function testModule() {\n  console.log(\"Testing the module\");\n  return true;\n}\n\n// Test the function\nconst result = testModule();\nconsole.log(\"Result:\", result);\n\n// More complex example\nclass DataProcessor {\n  constructor() {\n    this.data = [];\n  }\n\n  addData(item) {\n    this.data.push(item);\n  }\n\n  processData() {\n    return this.data.filter((item) => item > 0);\n  }\n}\n\n// Usage\nconst processor = new DataProcessor();\nprocessor.addData(5);\nprocessor.addData(-2);\nprocessor.addData(10);\nconsole.log(processor.processData()); // [5, 10]\n"}]}],"\n",["$","h2","h2-1",{"children":"Python Example"}],"\n",["$","pre","pre-1",{"children":["$","code","code-0",{"className":"language-python","children":"def analyze_data(data):\n    \"\"\"Analyze the provided data.\"\"\"\n    processed = []\n    for item in data:\n        if item > 0:\n            processed.append(item * 2)\n    return processed\n\n# Usage\ndata = [1, 2, -1, 4, -2, 5]\nresult = analyze_data(data)\nprint(f\"Processed data: {result}\")\n\n# Class-based approach\nclass DataAnalyzer:\n    def __init__(self):\n        self.results = []\n\n    def analyze(self, data_list):\n        \"\"\"Analyze a list of data points.\"\"\"\n        for data in data_list:\n            if isinstance(data, (int, float)) and data > 0:\n                self.results.append(data ** 2)\n        return self.results\n\n# Example usage\nanalyzer = DataAnalyzer()\nresult = analyzer.analyze([1, 2, -3, 4, 5])\nprint(f\"Analysis results: {result}\")\n"}]}],"\n",["$","h2","h2-2",{"children":"Best Practices"}],"\n",["$","p","p-2",{"children":"When testing modules:"}],"\n",["$","ol","ol-0",{"children":["\n",["$","li","li-0",{"children":[["$","strong","strong-0",{"children":"Write clear test cases"}]," - Make sure your tests are understandable"]}],"\n",["$","li","li-1",{"children":[["$","strong","strong-0",{"children":"Test edge cases"}]," - Don't just test the happy path"]}],"\n",["$","li","li-2",{"children":[["$","strong","strong-0",{"children":"Use descriptive names"}]," - Function and variable names should be self-documenting"]}],"\n",["$","li","li-3",{"children":[["$","strong","strong-0",{"children":"Keep it simple"}]," - Start with basic tests and build complexity gradually"]}],"\n"]}],"\n",["$","p","p-3",{"children":"The key is to ensure your modules work reliably across different scenarios!"}]]}]}]}],["$","footer",null,{"className":"mt-12 pt-8 border-t
